unnormalised: Okay, here's a draft Quora post:
normalised: Okay, here's a draft Quora post:

unnormalised: So, I've been hearing a lot about Ayurveda lately, especially in Bangalore where I live. It seems like everyone is trying out some Ayurvedic treatment for something or the other! I'm curious – what experiences have people had?
normalised: So, I've been hearing a lot about Ayurveda lately, especially in Bangalore where I live. It seems like everyone is trying out some Ayurvedic treatment for something or the other! I'm curious – what experiences have people had?

unnormalised: I’m thinking of trying it myself for my persistent back pain. I heard Dr. Sharma at the Kerala Ayurveda Centre, near Jayanagar, is really good. Someone told me his consultation fee is around Rs. 500, which seems reasonable. Has anyone been to him?
normalised: I’m thinking of trying it myself for my persistent back pain. I heard Doctor Sharma at the Kerala Ayurveda Centre, near Jayanagar, is really good. Someone told me his consultation fee is around rupee five hundred, which seems reasonable. Has anyone been to him?

unnormalised: I'm particularly interested in hearing about treatments for stress and sleep issues. My friend, Priya, swears by her daily dose of Ashwagandha – says it's a total game changer since she started taking it on 10/06/2023!
normalised: I'm particularly interested in hearing about treatments for stress and sleep issues. My friend, Priya, swears by her daily dose of Ashwagandha – says it's a total game changer since she started taking it on tenth June two thousand and twenty three!

unnormalised: Also, what about Panchakarma? It sounds intense! Is it worth the time commitment and the cost? I heard a full Panchakarma at a resort in Kerala can take up to 21 days and cost a small fortune.
normalised: Also, what about Panchakarma? It sounds intense! Is it worth the time commitment and the cost? I heard a full Panchakarma at a resort in Kerala can take up to twenty one days and cost a small fortune.

unnormalised: My aunt, Sunita aunty, went for some Ayurvedic massage for her arthritis back in 2020 and she said it gave her immense relief for almost 6 months.
normalised: My aunt, Sunita aunty, went for some Ayurvedic massage for her arthritis back in two thousand and twenty and she said it gave her immense relief for almost six months.

unnormalised: I’m also wondering about the best time to start an Ayurvedic treatment. Is there a particular season that's more beneficial? Perhaps around Diwali time?
normalised: I’m also wondering about the best time to start an Ayurvedic treatment. Is there a particular season that's more beneficial? Perhaps around Diwali time?

unnormalised: Any recommendations for reputable places in India or specific treatments you've found helpful? I'm open to travelling if needed – maybe even to Rishikesh. Planning a trip around 09:00 hrs, sometime next month.
normalised: Any recommendations for reputable places in India or specific treatments you've found helpful? I'm open to travelling if needed – maybe even to Rishikesh. Planning a trip around nine zero zero hours, sometime next month.

unnormalised: Please share your experiences and insights! Let's get a conversation going about Ayurveda and its benefits! I'm free to answer any questions at 17:00 hrs tomorrow if anyone has questions!
normalised: Please share your experiences and insights! Let's get a conversation going about Ayurveda and its benefits! I'm free to answer any questions at seventeen zero zero hours tomorrow if anyone has questions!
